newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks seen slightly lower after record.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks seen slightly lower after record.

text.p: Wall Street stocks were expected to open slightly lower on Monday, hurt by weakness in oil stocks and profit-taking after Friday's record close.
But market sentiment was expected to remain strong, with many investors now discounting the possibility of a sharp hike in interest rates by the Federal Reserve this month.
On Friday, the Dow industrials jumped 67 to an unofficial record of 5,839, its first close above 5800. The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composte also posted strong gains.
"We might be headed for a slightly lower opening and then some stabilization ... and an attempt to move higher," said Peter Cardillo, director of research at Westfalia Investments.
"I suspect we'll see profit-taking. Also, Iraq is putting pressure on the oil market which could weaken oil stocks," he said.
